Method Detail

getInstance

public static final VirtualHostManager getInstance()
Singleton access to the VHM. This prevents accidentally parsing the contents twice. The no-param version of the singleton selects automatically the local version of the shell execution adapter.

Returns:
Singleton instance of VirtualHostManager

getInstance

public static final VirtualHostManager getInstance(ConnectionType type)
Singleton access to the VHM. This prevents accidentally parsing the contents twice. This version of the singleton method lets you select the type of the shell you want to use.

Returns:
Singleton instance of VirtualHostManager

clearInstance

public static final void clearInstance()
Clears the singleton instance. Use this method if you need to re-init. the VHM for another directory. If you just need to reload the host list, use instance.clearHosts instead!

clearHosts

public final void clearHosts()
Clears the parsed list of hosts. Use this method if you need to refresh the host list from disk.

parseDirectoryContents

public void parseDirectoryContents(String directory)
                            throws IOException
Gets all files in the directory by using a private inner class as filter for the directory contents.

Parameters:
directory - The directory to read
Throws:
IOException
See Also:
VirtualHostManager.JVHDirectoryFiler

saveVirtualHost

public boolean saveVirtualHost(VirtualHostEntry vhost)
                        throws IOException
Saves the managed virtual host to his respective file.

Parameters:
vhost - the vhost entry
Returns:
true on successful save
Throws:
IOException

getHostList

public final Vector<VirtualHostEntry> getHostList()
returns all hosts parsed from the directory

Returns:
a(n) (empty) list of virtualhosts but never null

getVirtualHostEntry

public final VirtualHostEntry getVirtualHostEntry(String hostname)
Returns a single VirtualHostEntry by its hostname

Returns:
virtual host entry corresponding to the hostname or null

enableVirtualHost

public final boolean enableVirtualHost(VirtualHostEntry vhost)
Enables a virtual host using the default apache2 a2ensite tools. This must change as we want to support more than just the ubuntu or debian setup.

Parameters:
vhost - The vhost entry to enable
Returns:
true on success, false on failure

disableVirtualHost

public final boolean disableVirtualHost(VirtualHostEntry vhost)
Disables a virtual host using the default apache2 a2dissite tools. This must change as we want to support more than just the ubuntu or debian setup.

Parameters:
vhost - The vhost entry to enable
Returns:
true on success, false on failure

isVirtualHostInitiallySaved

public final boolean isVirtualHostInitiallySaved(VirtualHostEntry vhost)
Checks if the host file does already exist.

Parameters:
vhost - The vhost to check for
Returns:
true if the vhosts file does exist

isVirtualHostEnabled

public final boolean isVirtualHostEnabled(VirtualHostEntry vhost)
Checks if the vhost is enabled

Parameters:
vhost - The vhost to check for
Returns:
true for enabled

getPathToVirtualHostConfig

public final String getPathToVirtualHostConfig(VirtualHostEntry vhost)
Builds the path to the vhost config file. This demands on the override*Path members.

Parameters:
vhost - The vhost to assemble the path for
Returns:
the full path to the file

getVirtualHostFileName

public final String getVirtualHostFileName(VirtualHostEntry vhost)
Builds the filename of the vhost file.

Parameters:
vhost - The vhost to build the filename for
Returns:
the assembled filename

getOverrideApacheConfPath

public String getOverrideApacheConfPath()
This path sould come from the configuration instance later on.

Returns:
the path to the hosts-enabled directory

setOverrideApacheConfPath

public void setOverrideApacheConfPath(String overrideApacheConfPath)
This method is used for unit tests at the moment. Later on this value will be given by the configuration beans.

Parameters:
overrideApacheConfPath - full path to the hosts-enabled directory

getOverrideApacheEnabledPath

public String getOverrideApacheEnabledPath()
This path sould come from the configuration instance later on.

Returns:
the path to the hosts-available directory

setOverrideApacheEnabledPath

public void setOverrideApacheEnabledPath(String overrideApacheEnabledPath)
This method is used for unit tests at the moment. Later on this value will be given by the configuration beans.

Parameters:
overrideApacheEnabledPath - full path to the hosts-available directory
